description.narrative: 4.1: Social Policy, Evaluation and AdvocacySocial policy and evaluation works towards the social inclusion of Uganda's children and the fulfillment of their rights through generating and sharing evidence influencing national budgets, policy and legislation building national partnerships and supporting the development of a social protection system for Uganda's most vulnerable children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Y108 - Programme Component Results (PCR) 4 Cross SectoralIn target districts schools, health facilities and communities in emergency settings have improved water and sanitation facilities o and Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) is introduced in target villages.b) Increased influence of youth on national agenda for realization child rights, effective participatory communication processes for child focused behavioural and social change and increased awareness at national and international levels of situation of children and women in Uganda.c) Responsiveness of UN Delivery-As- One to child rights and development/scaling up of technological innovative approaches for improved service delivery, accountability and transparency.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Uganda Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1: Social Policy, Evaluation and AdvocacySocial policy and evaluation works towards the social inclusion of Uganda's childrenand the fulfillment of their rights through generating and sharing evidence; influencing national budgets, policy and legislation;building national partnerships; and supporting the development of a social protection system for Uganda?s most vulnerable children.
4.1.4. % of the Evaluations and studies included in the IMEP implemented and with management response where applicable
4.1.2 Number planned analytical thematic studies conducted that produce evidence to support development of appropriate human-rights based laws, policies and budgets that affect children.
4.1.3. Number of issues affecting children on which parliamentarians have been progressively engaged.
4.1.5 Adolescent Index and report developed and disseminated
